headline.main: Workplace Bias Tied to Obesity Is Ruled Illegal

docs.lead_paragraph: In the first Federal appeals decision of its kind, a three-judge panel in Boston ruled unanimously on Monday that job discrimination against severely obese people violated a Federal disabilities law. The case was brought by Bonnie Cook, a 5-foot 2-inch, 320-pound Rhode Island woman who was refused a job at a state center for retarded people because of her weight.
